text:
I have a properties file for a third party extension in the directory
jre/lib/ext of my JDK distribution which is version 1.5. When I deploy a WAR
file and tomcat attempts to compile the JSPs which are associated with that WAR,
it includes the .properties file as part of the compile path to the java
compiler and as such fails.

creator: cb@ing.iac.es

text:
Stuff in jre/lib/ext gets included, that's the purpose of that directory.  If
you don't want it include, don't put it there.
creator: yoavs@computer.org
cb@ing.iac.es
text:
Why this property file is in this directory is outside of my control. That
besides, adding anything other than .jar files and .class as input to javac is
just simply asking for trouble.
